text: Confused, are languages like python, ruby single threaded?
I was reading how Clojure is 'cool' because of its syntax + it runs on the JVM so it is multithreaded etc.
Are languages like ruby and python single threaded in nature then?
What are the underlying differences between python/ruby and say java running on tomcat?
Doesn't the web server have a pool of threads to work with in all cases?
